meanings.definition: To come forth into view or notice
meanings.sent1: The flower emerg from the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The sun emerg from behind the clouds in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat emerg from its hiding spot to surprise its owner.
meanings.sent4: The truth emerg from the tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The stars emerg in the night sky like diamonds.

meanings.definition: To rise out of a surrounding medium
meanings.sent1: The bubbles emerg from the water as it boils.
meanings.sent2: The fish emerg from the depths of the ocean to breathe.
meanings.sent3: The idea emerg from the brainstorming session unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Hope emerg from the darkness of despair.
meanings.sent5: The aroma emerg from the freshly baked bread.

meanings.definition: To come into being or have its starting point at a certain time or place
meanings.sent1: The river emerg from the mountains and flows into the valley.
meanings.sent2: The plan emerg during the team meeting.
meanings.sent3: Laughter emerg from the silly joke told by the clown.
meanings.sent4: Inspiration emerg from the artist's surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The solution emerg after hours of brainstorming.
